articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Message to Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Message to Syrian President
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, sent a reply message to Bashar Al-Assad, regional secretary of the Baath Arab Socialist Party and president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on Wednesday.
					 The message said:
					
					 I express sincere thanks to you for your warm congratulations and best wishes on the holding of the Seventh Congress of the WPK and my holding of the important post as chairman of the WPK at the Congress.
					
					 The true friendly sentiment and militant solidarity you showed to us greatly encourage our service personnel and people in their struggle to carry out the decision of the Seventh Congress of the WPK and hasten the final victory of the cause of the Juche revolution, the cause of the Songun revolution pioneered and led by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il under the leadership of the WPK.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I reiterate our invariable support and solidarity with the just struggle of the Syrian Arab people to meet all sorts of challenges of the hostile forces and defend the sovereignty, security and territorial integrity of the country under the guidance of you and the Baath Arab Socialist Party.
					
					 I wish you good health and bigger success in your work.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Back Home
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Back Home
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, came back home Thursday after taking part in the inaugural ceremony of the president of the Republic of Equatorial Guinea and officially visiting it. 
					 He was greeted by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Ri Mu Yong, vice-premier and minister of Chemical Industry, and Ri Kil Song, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.

articles.title: DPRK Workers Will Strive for Achieving National Reunification: Chairman of C.C., GFTUK
articles.content:
DPRK Workers Will Strive for Achieving National Reunification: Chairman of C.C., GFTUK
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il working class of the DPRK, the most dignified and proud one in the world, fully support the new line and policies for national reunification set forth by supreme leader Kim Jong Un, welcoming them as the most reasonable great programme for national reunification that indicated the bright path for overcoming the difficulties in the way to reunification and hastening it.
					 Ju Yong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK), said this in a statement on Thursday.
					
					 Stressing that national reunification is sure to be achieved under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, the statement noted it is the unanimous will of the working class of the DPRK to become a brave standard-bearer and driving force in the nation-wide movement for national reunification.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Our working class will turn out in the drive for paving the avenue to reunification, consistently holding fast to the three charters for national reunification which fully reflect the intention and demand of all Koreans and whose vitality was proved in practice.
					
					 It expressed expectation and belief that the working masses in south Korea including its workers will fulfill their responsibility and role for the times and the nation in the struggle for opening up a new chapter in the improvement of the north-south relations and the movement for national reunification by learning from the good precedents and experience gained in steering the reunification movement of all Koreans and contributing to the improvement of the north-south relations by pooling efforts with the workers in the northern half of Korea. It continued;
					
					 We will positively support the south Korean workers in their just struggle for rejecting the reckless political and military provocations and military drills being masterminded by the south Korean regime against the compatriots in the north, pursuant to the U.S., only to endanger peace and security on the Korean peninsula, and for removing all forms of legal and institutional mechanism against national reconciliation and unity and foiling the fascist suppression of the just patriotic struggle for reunification.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Line and Policies for National Reunification Supported by Youth League Chairman
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Line and Policies for National Reunification Supported by Youth League Chairman
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, in a statement on Thursday, fully supported and welcomed the line and policies for national reunification set forth by supreme leader Kim Jong Un at the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) on behalf of 5 million Korean youths, recognizing them as a scientific and fair and aboveboard programme for reunification.
					 The prevailing grim situation requires all youths to fulfill their responsibility and role as vanguard fighters in the drive for accomplishing the sacred cause of national reunification like the youths of former generations who dedicated their youth and lives to national reunification, the statement said, adding:
					
					 All youths and students in the north and the south and abroad should have a transparent viewpoint and attitude, strong pluck and self-confidence to settle the issue of national reunification by our nation itself and get united as one irrespective of differing isms, ideals and political views in order to carry out the great intention for national reunification.
					
					 I, on behalf of our 5 million youths fully prepared as stalwart fighters of
					
					the youth power under the care of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu,
					
					renew our firm pledge to fully display the spirit and mettle of the heroic
					
					youth of Juche Korea in the sacred struggle to pave a broad avenue to national reunification true to the line and policies advanced by Kim Jong
					
					Un.
					
					 I express expectation that the youths and students in south Korea and abroad would positively turn out in the patriotic struggle to foil the separatist moves of the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad and bring earlier the national reunification, the long-cherished desire of the nation, in hearty response to the ardent desire of all Koreans and the call of the times and history.

articles.title: DPRK Student Proves Successful at 24th International Juvenile Chopin Piano Contest
articles.content:
DPRK Student Proves Successful at 24th International Juvenile Chopin Piano Contest
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK student Ma Sin A proved successful at the 24th International Juvenile Chopin Piano Contest held in Poland.
					 The contest held from May 19 to 22 brought together at least 50 excellent juvenile players from 20 countries including the DPRK, Russia, Poland, Germany, France Austria and UK.
					
					 The contest was divided into three groups according to ages.
					
					 Ma successfully played music pieces requiring high skill and artistic talent in Group B, winning the admiration of members of jury and experts.
					
					 Ma Sin A was awarded prize for the first place, prizes for best acting and various diplomas to be given to excellent participants. She was invited to play at the international piano contest and piano concert to be held in Moscow and Budapest.
					
					 Meanwhile, another DPRK student Han Su Ryo was awarded prize for the second place in Group A and the prize of the Chopin art center fund.

articles.title: Mongolian Embassy Officials Help DPRK Farmers
articles.content:
Mongolian Embassy Officials Help DPRK Farmers
 Sariwon, May 26 (KCNA) -- Mongolian Ambassador Suren Tsoggerel and his embassy officials here did friendly labor at the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Jongbang Cooperative Farm on Thursday.
					 They looked round the room dedicated to the history of the farm aftger being briefed on the leadership exploits of the three commanders of Mt Paektu.
					
					  They helped farmers there in weeding maize fields.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president of Algeria, on May 12.
					 In the message the President said he was pleased to extend the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on his election as chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea on behalf of the government and people of Algeria and on his own behalf and wished Kim Jong Un success in his noble work for the well-being and prosperity of the friendly Korean people.
					
					 The message expressed the satisfaction over the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and confirmed the will to consolidate the friendly and cooperative relations together with Kim Jong Un in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of DR Congo
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of DR Congo
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, on May 16 received a congratulatory message from Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of the Democratic Republic of Congo.
					 The president in the message sent warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un upon his election to the high post of the Workers' Party of Korea on behalf of all the people of DR Congo and on his own behalf.
					
					 The president informed Kim Jong Un of his will to make positive efforts to boost the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Mozambican Party Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Mozambican Party Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Mozambique Liberation Front Party led by Secretary General Eliseu Joaquim Machava visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President and his family members, the members of the delegation looked round the historical relics preserved with much care at his old home.
					
					 The delegation toured the Party Founding Museum, the International Friendship Exhibition House, the Sci-Tech Complex, etc.

articles.title: German Delegation Here
articles.content:
German Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany led by Chairman Michael Koth arrived here Thursday.

articles.title: German Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
German Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Thursday.
					 The members of the delegation laid a bouquet before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Scientific Successes Made in DPRK
articles.content:
Scientific Successes Made in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Scientific successes have been registered one after another in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The decision, made at the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea, says that the scientific and technological field should play the leading role in stepping up the integration of the science, technology and economy and putting the country's economy on a modern and IT basis.
					
					 The Bioengineering Branch of the State Academy of Sciences succeeded in breeding a new strain of salt-resisting rice whose vitality is stronger than the existing ones.
					
					 The new strain was proved highly productive even in tideland-turned fields.
					
					 The Academy of Agricultural Science has bred a new strain of soybean, tolerant of bad weather and it can be planted as a second crop.
					
					 Kim Il Sung University has laid a foundation for realizing the local production of silicon steel sheet.
					
					 University of Sciences succeeded in locally making the hardening agent for mold.
					
					 Paper Engineering Institute of the State Academy of Sciences developed a new kind of paper machine capable of simultaneously manufacturing various kinds of paper, as well as pulp-transfer pump of simple structure easy to operate.

articles.title: Air Sports Encouraged in DPRK
articles.content:
Air Sports Encouraged in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Air clubs built in different parts of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have paid deep attention to making air sports popular.
					 Pyon Jong Ho, head of the Pyongyang City Air Club, told KCNA:
					
					 My club has carried on air sports service activities on a broad basis.
					
					 Training equipment and model gliders in training ground have come under attraction of visitors.
					
					 The club gives computer-aided service to visitors, which is helpful to flying remote-controlled model glider.
					
					 Citizens can fly model gliders at the May Day Stadium, Kaeson Youth Park and plaza of the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium.
					
					 The club has finished preparations for giving parachute service.
					
					 The club also gives air sports knowledge and technology to citizens through different forms and methods.
					
					 Meanwhile, the club makes big efforts to put training of professional athletes on a scientific basis.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Terms Obama's Planned Visit to Hiroshima Clumsy Diplomacy
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Terms Obama's Planned Visit to Hiroshima Clumsy Diplomacy
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- It was reported that U.S. President Obama would visit Hiroshima over which the world's first nuclear bomb was dropped.
					 It is the first time that the sitting American president will visit the city where hundreds of thousands of people were killed by an A-bomb during the Second World War.
					
					 The objective sought by Obama through his junket to Hiroshima to be made before the end of his office is to leave his initiative to build a "world without nuclear weapons" as his political legacy and confirm the alliance favorable to Washington's implementation of the "Asia-Pacific rebalancing" strategy by attracting Japan.
					
					 Japan on its part seeks the aim of not missing this opportunity to evade its responsibility for redeeming its past by improving its image as a "war victim country" as it is always cold-shouldered by the international community for its inglorious past. 
					
					 The above-said event cannot but be viewed as diplomacy of the U.S. and the Japanese authorities seeking different purposes, prompted by their mean political calculation.
					
					 Obama's trip to the A-bombed city would not help hide the true colors of the U.S. as a country of nuclear war maniacs and nuke proliferators as it has stepped up the modernization of its nuclear weapons under the spurious mask of building a "world without nuclear weapons."
					
					 Obama is seized with the wild ambition to dominate the world by dint of the U.S. nuclear edge only.
					
					 The U.S. in its "quadrennial defense strategy review report" mapped out in 2010 adopted it as a policy to ensure the unilateral edge of its nuclear force under the signboard of "nuclear disarmament" by underlining the need to maintain its nuclear arsenal till the goal of building a "world without nuclear weapons" is attained.
					
					 The U.S. has misled the public opinion by creating impression that the "nuclear threat" from the DPRK is the biggest problem facing the international community, far from reflecting on the worst nuclear crimes it committed by having threatened humankind with nuclear weapons for decades.
					
					 Wendy Sherman, former parliamentary undersecretary of the U.S. Department of State, asserted that Washington and Tokyo should make efforts to remain true to their commitment to ensuring peace despite nuclear threat from north Korea with Obama's Hiroshima visit as a momentum.
					
					 The U.S. is trumpeting about someone's "nuclear threat" and "a world without nuclear weapons" though it has desperately worked to throw the Korean peninsula and other parts of the world into shambles of a thermonuclear war any moment by modernizing its nuclear weapons and blackmailing others with those weapons. This is the height of hypocrisy and impudence. 
					
					 What the survivors of the A-bomb disasters in Japan want to hear from Obama is nothing but the answer to the question as to whether he can completely eliminate the nuclear weapons in the world or not
					
					 Japan's ulterior design should never be overlooked.
					
					 Through Obama's visit to Hiroshima Japan seeks to put under carpet its true colors as a provocateur of the war and aggressor and go with impunity despite its past crimes by stirring up the "feelings of war victims" among its people and giving the international community a strong impression that it is a "war victim."
					
					 Such clumsy political calculation of the U.S. and Japan will only result in heightened vigilance of the international community.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Validity of DPRK's Access to Nuclear Weapons
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on Validity of DPRK's Access to Nuclear Weapons
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The international community is becoming vocal supporting the validity of the DPRK's access to nuclear weapons for self-defence.
					 It is the comment of public opinion that the DPRK's access to nukes is obviously aimed to hold in check any aggression and military attack and concentrate efforts on economic construction and it is a stark reality that the U.S. dares not make a preemptive attack on the DPRK.
					
					 Valery Lashkin, deputy to the State Duma of Russia who doubles as vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, referred to the will of the DPRK manifested at the Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea to adhere to the validity of its stand and hold dialogue with all countries having no intent to invade it, adding that its leadership is meeting the challenges against its sovereignty in the most proper manner.
					
					 Sergei Chernyakhovski, Prof. and Dr. of the Political Faculty of Moscow State University, said:
					
					 When one looks back on the history of the DPRK without prejudice and compares what happened in the past with the present politics, one can come to an easy conclusion that it is the most peace-loving country in the world.
					
					 It is the country that neither fought with other countries nor got involved in any military dispute among countries sharing border with it after the war in the 1950s.
					
					 It was clarified at the recent Party Congress that the DPRK would not be the first to use nuclear weapons unless it is invaded. This is a very just position as it is nothing surprising.
					
					 It is a very simple logic that if a country has access to nukes and is not ready to use them, it is bound to go to ruin.
					
					 The DPRK is the country from which we can learn a lot, indeed.
					
					 The Swiss internet magazine Le Grand said:
					
					 There is a clear intention and reason for north Korea to push ahead with the development of nuclear weapons and experts clearly recognize the fact that the DPRK poses no "threat."
					
					 North Korea laid down the line of simultaneously developing the two fronts to cope with the U.S. north Korea policy and is preventing any aggression and attack with its creditable nuclear deterrence and diverting the expenses and resources for the service personnel on the frontline units and huge artillery force to economic construction by drastically cutting down their number. 
					
					 The hawks of the West, the ultra-right forces of Japan, in particular, are dreaming of their access to nukes under the pretext of "nuclear threat" from north Korea, and the U.S. is seeking to establish a new MD system in south Korea capable of neutralizing China, not aimed at containing north Korea under that pretext.
					
					 Some countries may underestimate north Korea's recent declaration not to mount a preemptive nuclear attack but there is need for them to take note of the fact that the history of nuclear deterrence started with such declaration and this promise has been kept.
					
					 As commented by world public, the DPRK's access to nuclear weapons is the most just choice in the present world where a weak country can never protect itself.
					
					 The DPRK will never dismantle its nuclear weapons first unless the U.S. rolls back its hostile policy toward the former and defuses its nuclear threat fundamentally.
					
					 It will bolster its nuclear deterrence both in quality and quantity to firmly protect its sovereignty as long as the U.S. persists in nuclear threat and hostile policy.

articles.title: Federal Formula Is Only Way of Peaceful National Reunification: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Federal Formula Is Only Way of Peaceful National Reunification: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Federal formula is the only way of achieving the country's reunification peacefully in conformity with aspiration and desire of the entire Korean nation, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The reunification by federal formula serves as the way of achieving the country's reunification peacefully as required by the will and demand of all Koreans under the specific conditions prevailing in Korea.
					
					 The reunification by federal formula is the proposal of reunification common to the nation declared at home and abroad through the historic June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 In the joint declaration the north and the south agreed to recognize the commonness of the north side's low-stage proposal by federal formula and the south side's proposal by confederal formula and strive for reunification in this direction in the future. 
					
					 The south Korean conservative ruling forces are viciously slandering the June 15 joint declaration and articles related to the reunification by federal formula specified in the joint declaration and totally denied the implementation of the declaration, while reneging on the commitments they made to the Koreans and disregarding the sincere efforts of the DPRK.
					
					 To deny the idea and social system of the opposite side and seek unification by one side's idea and social system is no more than the expression of the intent not to reunify the country but to ignite a war.
					
					 The north and the south should take the road of founding a federal state in conformity with aspiration and demand of the entire nation on the basis of recognizing and tolerating each other's ideas and social systems.
					
					 If the reunification by federal formula is achieved, the Korean nation will be able to establish the sovereignty in a nationwide scale and Korea will be glorified as an independent, peace-loving and prosperous reunified power.

articles.title: Only Way out for U.S. Is to Roll back Its Hostile Policy towards DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Only Way out for U.S. Is to Roll back Its Hostile Policy towards DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The Wall Street Journal said that Marshal Kim Jong Un's declaration of the dynamic struggle to put an end to the U.S. threat of a nuclear war with powerful nuclear deterrent at the Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) suggested the DPRK's capabilities to mount a nuclear strike at the U.S. mainland.
					The National Interest, the U.S. magazine dealing with the international relations, asserted that the UN and the U.S. ratcheted up the sanctions but they are far less likely to change the DPRK. As the DPRK has codified the access to nukes and put it forward as an idea of the WPK, the only way out for the U.S. is to start the negotiations with the DPRK, it noted.
					
					  Prestigious experts on political situation and mass media of the world commented that the DPRK, which has miniaturized nuclear warheads to be mounted on ballistic missiles, may produce 20-100 nuclear weapons by 2020. If the U.S. sticks to the high-profile pressure on the DPRK for its change as now, the DPRK's nuclear negotiating position will grow stronger when the next U.S. president comes to power and this will pose an increasing threat to the U.S. hour by hour and present itself as an issue pending an urgent solution, it added.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					These voices of the world reflect the strategic position of the DPRK which has joined the advanced ranks of nuclear powers and the ever-changing trend of the times.
					
					The commentary goes on:
					
					For the U.S. to roll back its hostile policy towards the DPRK meets the requirements of the ever-changing international relations and is very helpful to the world peace and security.
					
					The DPRK doesn't beg the U.S. to roll back its hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					It doesn't care about whether the U.S. withdraws its hostile policy or not.
					
					The U.S. authorities would be well advised to bear in mind the only way out for them is to roll back its anachronistic hostile policy against the backdrop of acute DPRK-U.S stand-off.

articles.title: Minju Joson Blames S. Korean Military Warmongers for Escalating Tension
articles.content:
Minju Joson Blames S. Korean Military Warmongers for Escalating Tension
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean military warmongers staged the firing drill in waters around five islands in the West Sea under the pretext of coping with someone's "provocation" and the combined marine drills with the U.S. Navy in the West and South seas of Korea by mobilizing the warships, while crying out for coping with someone's SLBM.
					 Minju Joson Thursday says in a commentary that their moves are the dangerous military provocation aimed at chilling the climate for national reconciliation and enthusiasm of the Korean nation for national reunification which are mounting with the fresh line and policies for national reunification set forth by the DPRK as a momentum. Their moves are also aimed at harassing peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and in the region.
					
					 The commentary says that the DPRK is making sincere efforts to ensure peace and security on the peninsula.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 However, the south Korean authorities are resorting to the moves for a war of aggression quite contrary to the DPRK's efforts. This is, indeed, their open declaration that they would continue to escalate the military confrontation, instead of repairing the north-south relations through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are persistently slandering the DPRK's self-defensive nuclear deterrent and getting reckless in their war moves for invading the north in collusion with the U.S. under the pretext of coping with it. Their acts only result in escalating the situation on the Korean peninsula and in Northeast Asia and increasing the danger of a nuclear war.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities are truly willing to improve the north-south relations, they should come out for dialogue and negotiations with a sincere and honest stand, not seeking sinister purposes any longer.
					
					 They should also stop all their hostile acts against the DPRK such as the reckless political and military provocation and war exercises being staged, pursuant to the U.S. policy, only to do harm to the compatriots in the north and harass peace and security on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Stop to Suppression of Teachers Union Members Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to Suppression of Teachers Union Members Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- 13 city and provincial education superintendents across south Korea made public a statement in protest against the authorities' unreasonable step to suppress core members of the Teachers Union (Jongyojo), according to CBS of south Korea on May 24.
					 The statement condemned the Ministry of Education for taking a step to dismiss core members from their public jobs as a follow-up to the court's ruling that outlawed Jongyojo.
					
					 Terming the distrust of the present regime manifested in the April "National Assembly" election an eruption of the public anger at its anachronistic retrogressive policies, the statement urged the authorities to immediately retract the above-said step.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Send Back DPRK's Citizens Immediately
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Send Back DPRK's Citizens Immediately
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), issued a statement on May 24 to denounce the south Korean authorities for alluring and abducting a group of the DPRK's citizens.
					 The statement said that all the officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan are hardly repressing surging resentment and hatred against the south Korean authorities for such unprecedented heinous terrorist act of taking a group of the DPRK's citizens to south Korea after alluring and abducting them as part of their frantic moves for vicious confrontation with fellow countrymen in the north and for war provocation.
					
					 The abduction case is a premeditated and organized heinous anti-DPRK case aimed to tarnish the ever-mounting prestige of the DPRK and cook up a new "north wind" for the "National Assembly" election, the statement charged, and went on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities should take all steps at once so that the families of the victims could go to Seoul to meet their daughters face to face as ardently requested by them.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should accept the strong demand of the Koreans and world conscience, apologize for the unheard-of allurement and abduction and send the DPRK's women back without delay and unconditionally.
					
					 If they continue concealing their crime and unreasonably keep the DPRK's citizens in custody, they will face the unanimous denunciation by all the Koreans and the international community.
					
					 We hope that the progressive organizations and people of all countries including Japan would incriminate the unethical crime of the south Korean authorities, galvanize international opinion and thus make efforts so that the DPRK's citizens would come back to the care of their families at an early date.

articles.title: Koreans in China Determined to Strive for Opening Avenue to National Reunification
articles.content:
Koreans in China Determined to Strive for Opening Avenue to National Reunification
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Cha Sang Bo, vice-chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, issued a statement on Tuesday to support the joint statement of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations.
					 As soon as the new line and policies for national reunification clarified by supreme leader Kim Jong Un at the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea were open to public, they were heartily supported and hailed by the international community as well as by the Korean people at home and abroad, the statement said.
					
					 Extending full support to the joint statement which reflected the unanimous will and desire of the whole Korean nation for detente on the Korean peninsula and a critical breakthrough in the national reunification by improving the catastrophic inter-Korean relations, the statement noted:
					
					 The south Korean authorities are well advised to get rid of slavish submission to the U.S., make a bold decision to part from the humiliating pro-U.S. policy and abandon the humiliating cooperation with the outsiders that defame the fellow countrymen.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should bid farewell to their stereotyped attitude of responding to the sincerity and proposal of the DPRK for national reconciliation with ill-mannered refusal, war games and nuclear blackmail, roll back the hostile policies towards the DPRK and tackle the improvement of the inter-Korean relations with honest approach.
					
					 The General Association of Koreans in China and all Koreans in China will bear deep in mind the firm faith that the prosperous and reunified power will be built in Korea in the near future as they are led by illustrious commander of Paektu Kim Jong Un and more dynamically wage a patriotic struggle to open up an avenue to independent reunification in response to his patriotic call.

articles.title: 7th Congress of WPK Celebrated in DPRK Embassies Abroad
articles.content:
7th Congress of WPK Celebrated in DPRK Embassies Abroad
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Events took place in the DPRK embassies in foreign countries to celebrate the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 They included receptions, Korean photo and book exhibitions and film shows in Cambodia, Myanmar, Bangladesh, Venezuela, Brazil, Germany, Austria, Uganda, South Africa and Algeria from May 16 to 21.
					
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos dealing with the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, and books and photos introducing the army and people of the DPRK who turned out in the all-out onward campaign for winning the final victory.
					
					 The participants of the film shows watched the Korean films "Grand Celebration of 70th Founding Anniversary of Workers' Party of Korea in Presence of Respected Comrade Kim Jong Un", "Masikryong Ski Resort", "Songdowon International Children's Camp" and "Pyongyang Today".
					
					 The general coordinator of the Federal Secretariat of the United Left Party of Venezuela said that Kim Jong Un's election as chairman of the WPK reflects the boundless trust of the Korean people in him who made immortal contributions to the Korean revolution and accomplishment of the cause of global independence.
					
					 The vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil said that nobody can match the Korean people who wholeheartedly follow their leader and are closely united around him. 
					
					 The deputy prime minister of Uganda said that Kim Jong Un who is identical to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il was elected chairman of the WPK and therefore the single-minded unity of the DPRK, the unique one in the world, would be more firmly consolidated.

articles.title: Venezuelan Newspaper Hails Successful Seventh Congress of WPK
articles.content:
Venezuelan Newspaper Hails Successful Seventh Congress of WPK
Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The Venezuelan newspaper Vea in an article on May 21 hailed the successful Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The article said:
					
					 The Seventh Congress of the WPK elected the respected Comrade Kim Jong Un as chairman of the WPK in reflection of the unanimous will and desire of all party members, service personnel and other people.
					
					 Kim Jong Un is the supreme leader of the Korean people who has exalted the dignity and might of Kim Il Sung's nation, Kim Jong Il's Korea all over the world with his outstanding idea, superb leadership and noble virtue.
					
					 He opened up a new chapter for accomplishing the cause of perpetuating the memory of the leaders.
					
					 Under his leadership, the single-minded unity of the WPK and the revolutionary ranks has been consolidated more firmly and remarkable successes made in all fields including politics, economy and culture.
					
					 Upon receiving the news of his election as chairman of the WPK at its Seventh Congress, Venezuelan political parties, institutions and organizations for friendship and solidarity with the DPRK extended sincere congratulations to him and wished the WPK and the Korean people victory and successes.
					
					 The WPK and the Korean people are positively supporting the struggle of the government and people of Venezuela.

articles.title: Egyptian Politician Censures S. Korean Regime's Unethical Crime
articles.content:
Egyptian Politician Censures S. Korean Regime's Unethical Crime
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Wahid Al Uksouri, chairman of the Arab Socialist Party of Egypt, released a statement on May 19 censuring the south Korean regime for masterminding the group abduction of DPRK's citizens.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The south Korean regime let gangster-like agents of the Intelligence Service allure and abduct citizens of the DPRK in group.
					
					 We bitterly denounce this hideous crime that encroached upon the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK and wantonly abused the human rights.
					
					 The south Korean regime should take a substantial step to ensure the face-to-face meeting of the parents with their abducted daughters in Seoul.
					
					 The south Korean regime should apologize to the DPRK for the crime and take a step to repatriate the abductees without delay.
					
					 Affirming our positive support for the DPRK, we demand the UN and all other international bodies take a prompt measure to prevent the aggravation of situation to be entailed by the abduction case and guarantee the impartiality of the human rights.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de respuesta a presidente sirio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de respuesta a presidente sirio
Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, envio el dia 25 un mensaje de respuesta a Bashar al-Assad, Secretario Regional del Partido Socialista del Resurgimiento Arabe (BAAS) y Presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria. 
					El texto senala:
					
					Hago llegarle a Vd. mi sincero agradecimiento por haberme enviado calurosas felicitaciones y saludo con motivo de la realizacion del VII Congreso del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y mi eleccion en el cargo importante del Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					El sentimiento sincero de amistad y la solidaridad combativa, manifestados por Vd., estimulan mucho la lucha de nuestro ejercito y pueblo tendientes a materializar la resolucion del VII Congreso del Partido y adelantar la victoria final de la causa revolucionaria del Juche, la del Songun, iniciada y conducida por los grandes companeros Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il, bajo la orientacion del PTC.
					
					Aprovechando esta oportunidad, reafirmo nuestro invariable apoyo y solidaridad con la justa lucha del pueblo arabe de Siria por rechazar los desafios de toda indole de las fuerzas hostiles y defender la soberania, la seguridad y la integridad territorial del pais, bajo la guia de Vd. y el Partido Socialista del Resurgimiento Arabe, y deseo a Vd. buena salud y mayores exitos en su trabajo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam regresa a patria
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam regresa a patria
Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- Regreso el dia 26 el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, que participo en el acto de toma de posesion del presidente de la Republica de Guinea Ecuatorial y realizo la visita oficial a este pais africano.
					  Lo acogieron el vicepresidente del Presidium de la APS de la RPDC, Yang Hyong Sop, el vicepremier y ministro de Industria Quimica, Ri Mu Yong y el vicecanciller Ri Kil Song.

articles.title: Delegacion de PTC se reune con Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Delegacion de PTC se reune con Raul Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- La delegacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea encabezada por Kim Yong Chol, miembro del Buro Politico y vicepresidente del Comite Central del PTC, se reunio el dia 24 en la sede de Consejo de Estado con Raul Castro Ruz, Primer Secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba y Presidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba.
					Kim entrego al mandatario cubano el saludo, mensaje personal y presente que le enviara el Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Y le encomendo que transmitiera el saludo camaraderil formulado por el Mariscal para Fidel Castro Ruz.
					
					Felicito la reeleccion de Raul Castro Ruz como Primer Secretario del CC del PCC y la efectuacion exitosa del VII Congreso del PCC.
					
					Evaluo que el partido y el gobierno de Cuba presentaron la linea adecuada a su situacion manteniendo invariablemente los principios socialistas y alcanzan grandes exitos en la construccion socialista.
					
					Expreso agradecimiento por el que el pais caribeno envia el entero apoyo y solidaridad con la lucha del partido y el pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, cumpliendo con la obligacion revolucionaria y afirmo la posicion invariable del PTC de consolidar y desarrollar las relaciones camaraderiles y hermanas con el PCC en acato a los legados del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Raul Castro Ruz felicito con sinceridad la efectuacion exitosa del VII Congreso del PTC.
					
					Expreso respeto al Mariscal y deseo de encontrarse con el y agrego que el Mariscal se asemeja al Presidente Kim Il Sung, fundador del PTC y es un hombre inteligente y entusiasmado al ver estilo de su escritura.
					
					Enfatizo que es invariable la posicion del partido y el gobierno de Cuba de consolidar y desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con la RPDC, diciendo que estas relaciones son las camaraderiles y hermanas  confirmadas historicamente.

articles.title: ACNC comenta visita de Obama a Hiroshima
articles.content:
ACNC comenta visita de Obama a Hiroshima
Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- Dicen que el presidente estadounidense Obama visitara Hiroshima en que se lanzo por primera vez la bomba atomica exterminando a cientos de miles de habitantes.
					Sera por primera vez su visita en calidad del presidente titular de Estados Unidos a la ciudad damnificada por la bomba atomica durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial.
					
					A traves de su visita, Obama, que deja un poco de tiempo de su presidencia, trata de dejar como herencia politica la insistencia en el "mundo sin armas nucleares" y de atraer a Japon para asegurar las relaciones de alianza favorables al impulso de la estrategia del "reequilibrio de Asia y el Pacifico". Mientras tanto, Japon, repudiado por la sociedad internacional por su pasado criminal, intenta aprovechar esta oportunidad para esquivar la liquidacion del pasado bajo el pretexto del "pais damnificado de la guerra".
					
					Es una hipocrita actuacion diplomatica y calculo politico pueril de las autoridades de EE.UU. y Japon que persiguen, respectivamente, sus intenciones malsanas.
					
					Aunque visite la zona damnificada, el mandatario norteamericano no podra encubrir su naturaleza del fanatico de guerra nuclear y proliferador de armas nucleares, que da acicate a la modernizacion de estos pertrechos bajo el enganoso rotulo de la construccion del "mundo sin armas  nucleares".
					
					Obama siempre esta preso de la ambicion de tomar la heguemonia mundial basada en la supremacia nuclear.
					
					A traves de la visita a Hiroshima, Obama trata de decir otra vez su proyecto del "mundo sin armas nucleares" expuesto desde el principio de su mandato y ocultar su naturaleza como delincuente nuclear.
					
					En su "reporte cuatrienal de la estrategia de defensa" elaborado en 2010, el pais norteamericano insistio en que debe mantener el deposito de armas nucleares hasta cuando se alcance la meta del "mundo desnuclearizado", asi que politizo asegurar la supremacia unilateral de las fuerzas armadas nucleares bajo el rotulo del "desarme nuclear".
					
					Ahora, EE.UU., dando espalada a sus crimenes nucleares nunca vistos y a la historia pasado de decenios en que amenazo y chantajeo a la humanidad con las armas nucleares, divulga un rumor de que la "amenaza nuclear" de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea constituye el mayor problema que  enfrenta la sociedad internacional.
					
					Wendy Sherman, ex secretaria adjunta de Estado para los asuntos politicos de EE.UU. disparateo que "aprovechando la visita a Hiroshima de Obama, Washington y Tokio deberan esforzarse por la promesa mutua sobre el aseguramiento de la paz, aun en medio de las incesantes amenazas nucleares de Norte de Corea".
					
					El imperio yanqui habla de la "amenaza nuclear" y el "mundo desnuclearizado" acusando a alguien mientras se entrega a la modernizacion de armas nucleares y al chantaje nuclear para poner en cualquier momento la Peninsula Coreana y el resto del mundo en el remolino de la guerra termonuclear, lo cual deviene el climax de hipocresia y descaro.
					
					Hoy en dia, los sobrevivientes japoneses del bombardeo de bomba atomica quieren preguntar a Obama si EE.UU. eliminaria para siempre las armas nucleares del mundo.
					
					A traves de la visita a Hiroshima, EE.UU. debera contestar precisamente a esta pregunta.
					
					Tampoco es tolerable el intento siniestro de Japon.
					
					El pais isleno que invita a Obama a la ciudad afectada persigue el proposito de quitar la deshonra de criminal de guerra y disfrazarse como victima y encubrir el crimen antietico de categoria especial cometido en el pasado por el imperialismo japones.
					
					Japon quiere elevar al extremo en el pais el "sentimiento de victima" de los habitantes nacionales y por el exterior, inculcar la impresion de que Japon es tambien la "victima de guerra", de modo que intenta ocultar el caracter verdadero del autor del estallido de guerra y del agresor y recibir la absolucion sobre el crimen cometido en el pasado.
					
					El pueril calculo politico de EE.UU. y Japon genera solo la mayor vigilancia de la sociedad internacional.
